poem:
Title: An Ode to Peas and Pasta

Rise, my little green gems, in verdant rebellion,
Desire not the swift disguise of starch and sugar's kiss,
Instead, form a quiet consortium with the cloaked carbohydrates,
Ensconced in raiments of nourishment, becoming unassuming revolutionaries,
Wave high the banner of Glucose's new regime,
And let the blood-rivers run steady, let health be unseized.
So give peas their chance, and let pasta dress for the feast.
